meanings.definition: A person who is a follower or student of a particular teacher or philosophy.
meanings.sent1: As an exciples of his teachings, she always tried to live by the wise words of her mentor.
meanings.sent2: The exciples of the great philosopher gathered to discuss his profound ideas.
meanings.sent3: The exciples of the chef were so dedicated that they even dreamt of cooking delicious meals.
meanings.sent4: She embraced the exciples of kindness and compassion, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The exciples of hard work and perseverance led him to achieve his goals against all odds.

meanings.definition: A model or example to be followed or imitated.
meanings.sent1: The successful entrepreneur became an exciples for many aspiring business owners.
meanings.sent2: Children often look up to superheroes as exciples of bravery and heroism.
meanings.sent3: The exciples of fashion set by the designer were quickly adopted by trendsetters.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to fitness served as an exciples for others striving for a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The exciples of excellence in craftsmanship inspired a new generation of artisans.

meanings.sent1: Honesty and integrity were the exciples that guided his every decision.
meanings.sent2: The exciples of equality and justice formed the basis of their social movement.
meanings.sent3: The exciples of teamwork and collaboration were evident in their successful project.
meanings.sent4: She held fast to the exciples of loyalty and trust in all her relationships.
meanings.sent5: The exciples of perseverance and determination fueled his journey to success.
